column4: I just joined, but if your CPU fan is working hard, chances are your CPU is running hot. Have you tried installing lm-sensors?
can it help to control the fan speed?

Well, it will give you the temps of your CPU, and then you can go from there. Generally you can adjust fan settings in the BIOS. I actually don't know a "speedfan" sort of app for Ubuntu, but I'm sure there is one.
